text:
Other per-share measures include cash flow per share, EBIT per share, and EBITDA per
share. Per share measures are not comparable because the number of outstanding shares
differ among firms. For example, assume Firm A and Firm B both report net income of
$100. If Firm A has 100 shares outstanding, its EPS is $1 per share. If Firm B has 20
shares outstanding, its EPS is $5 per share.
